W. Pomeroy's 1906 statue of [[Lady Justice]] on the dome of the [[Old Bailey]] (Central Criminal Court) in London. | pronunciation = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1958|1|6|df=y}} | birth_name = Edward Francis Trevenen Brown | birth_place = [[London]], England | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = British | parents = | author = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | alma_mater = | known_for = Advocacy in high-profile criminal cases with international element | profession = [[Barristers in England and Wales|Barrister]] | occupation = Barrister at [[QEB Hollis Whiteman (chambers)]], [[Treasury devil|Senior Treasury Counsel]], [[Recorder (judge)|Crown Court Recorder]] at [[Southwark Crown Court]], member of [[UNMIK]] Detention Review Board, Trustee of Growing Against Violence charity | website = [http://www.qebholliswhiteman.co.uk/queen-s-counsel/edward-brown-qc.aspx.html qebholliswhiteman.co.uk] }}
'''Edward Francis Trevenen Brown'''<ref name="“The Law Pages">{{cite news |title=The Law Pages: Edward Brown QC |url=http://www.thelawpages.com/legal-directory/Edward-Francis-Trevenen-Brown-QC-54075-3.law |accessdate=17 August 2017 |date=17 August 2017}}</ref> [[Queen's Counsel|QC]] (born January 1958) is an English [[barrister]] who specialises in [[international criminal law]] and [[human rights law|human rights]]. He is one of the most senior [[prosecutor]]s at the [[Old Bailey]]<ref name="QEB Hollis Whiteman"/> where he also served as a Recorder, as well as sitting as a part-time circuit judge at [[Southwark Crown Court]].<ref name="“009863">{{cite news |title=The Sun: Recorder Edward Brown QC |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/4841333/paedophile-vigilantes-confront-pervert-football-coach-parliament-video-jailed/ |accessdate=10 November 2017 |date=10 November 2017}}</ref> Brown has written extensively on [[gang violence]] and [[joint enterprise|joint enterprise murder]]<ref name="The Lawyer">{{cite news|title=Kinder’s casebook: Landmark ruling reinterprets law of joint enterprise |url=https://l2b.thelawyer.com/kinders-casebook-landmark-ruling-reinterprets-law-of-joint-enterprise/ |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=thelawyer.com|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> in ''[[The Times]]''.<ref name="TimesOnline">{{cite news|title=Joint enterprise: review sentencing levels to prevent injustice |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/joint-enterprise-review-sentencing-levels-to-prevent-injustice-fhqgrmt0pgp |accessdate=23 July 2017 |publisher=TheTimes| date=23 July 2017}}</ref>
==Career at the Bar== Brown was [[Call to the Bar|called to the Bar]] in 1983. He currently practises at [[QEB Hollis Whiteman (chambers)|QEB Hollis Whiteman]] in London, chambers of [[Mark Ellison|Mark Ellison QC]], where he heads specialist criminal department.<ref name="Legal500">{{cite news|title=CHAMBERS OF MARK ELLISON QC |url=http://www.legal500.com/firms/9590/offices/9590/lawyers/78695 |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=Legal500|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> After beginning his career both prosecuting and defending, Brown specialised in prosecution work from 1986, including several cases of [[murder]], [[terrorism]] and [[organised crime]]. He took silk (i.e. appointed [[Queen's Counsel]]) in 2008.<ref name="QEB Hollis Whiteman">{{cite news|title=QEB Hollis Whitman: Edward Brown QC Profile |url=http://www.qebholliswhiteman.co.uk/queen-s-counsel/edward-brown-qc.aspx.html |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> For most of his career he has practiced at the [[Old Bailey]].<ref name="Legal500"/>[[File:London - Old Bailey.jpg|right|thumb|Mr Brown is one of the most senior prosecutors at the Old Bailey where he also served as a Recorder.]]
===Appointments=== In 2000 Brown was appointed Junior Treasury Counsel at the [[Old Bailey]], where he served as a [[Recorder (judge)]] from 2001.<ref name="Circuit Judges appointments">{{cite web|title=Judiciary.gov.uk courts and tribunals of England and Wales |url=https://www.judiciary.gov.uk/about-the-judiciary/who-are-the-judiciary/list-of-members-of-the-judiciary/circuit-judge-list/ |publisher=Judiciary.gov.uk |accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref> In 2007 he was appointed [[Treasury devil|Senior Treasury Counsel]], serving in that capacity until 2014.<ref name="Legal500"/> In 2015 Brown became a [[Bencher]] of [[Gray’s Inn]].<ref name="Chambers and partners">{{cite web|title=Chambers and Partners|url=https://www.chambersandpartners.com/UK-Bar/person/231197/edward-brown|publisher=Chambers & Partnersr|accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref>
==Human rights== {{Rights}} In 2014 Brown became a member of Detention Review Board of [[United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo]].<ref name="QEB">{{cite web|title=QEB Profiles: Edward Brown QC|url=http://www.qebholliswhiteman.co.uk/queen-s-counsel/edward-brown-qc.aspx.html |publisher=QEB |accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref>
==Defence== Brown has represented the [[Crown Prosecution Service|prosecution]], corporate entities and individuals in allegations of corporate crime, corruption, corporate manslaughter and tax investigations.<ref name="Tax Connections">{{cite news|title=Tax connections |url=https://www.taxconnections.com/events/A-Practical-and-Interactive-One-Day-Seminar---Treasury-For-Tax-People/78|accessdate=25 July 2017|publisher=Tax connections |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> In 2009 Brown acted for [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] politicians in [[Cash for Peerages]] police inquiry - no charges against MP's were brought.<ref name="Tax Connections"/> In 2016 Brown was appointed as leading Counsel to represent the [[Crown Prosecution Service|CPS]] at the [[Independent Inquiry into Child Sexual Abuse]].<ref name="IICSA Inquiry">{{cite news|title=IICSA Inquiry (Preliminary) Janner investigation |url=https://www.iicsa.org.uk/key-documents/406/view/iicsa-janner-preliminary-hearing-2016-03-09.pdf |accessdate=23 July 2017 |date=23 July 2017}}</ref>
===Notable cases=== ====SFO==== * In 2016 Brown represented Serious Fraud Office in a widely publicesed case involving former [[Barclays Bank|Barclays]] boss who was charged with [[fraud]].<ref name="SFO01">{{cite news |title=The SFO has instructed QEB Hollis Whiteman's Edward Brown QC, and 3 Verulam Buildings' duo Matthew Parker and Theodore van Sante. |url=http://www.legalbusiness.co.uk/index.php/lb-blog-view/8303-simmons-defends-barclays-on-former-top-executive-s-employment-dispute |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=July 2017}}</ref> The SFO also charged him with a count of unlawful financial assistance over a $3 billion loan the bank made to Qatar’s finance and economy ministry.<ref name="SFO02">{{cite news |title=Former Barclays bosses head to court over fraud charges |url=https://www.ftadviser.com/regulation/2017/07/17/barclays-execs-given-two-years-to-prepare-for-trial/ |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=July 2017}}</ref> * In 2017 Brown acted as a district attorney for SFO in Barclays prosecution case which was among the most high-profile cases ever to be brought by the SFO.<ref name="SFO04">{{cite news |title=Ex Barclays executives in dock to deal with criminal charges |url=http://news.finance.co.uk/ex-barclays-executives-dock-deal-criminal-charges/ |accessdate=23 August 2017 |date=23 August 2017}}</ref>
==Prosecution== Brown was instructed by the CPS in many of the highest profile British criminal cases including prosecution of [[Kevin Hutchinson-Foster]] who passed the BBM Bruni Model 92 handgun to [[Mark Duggan]] shortly before the minicab in which Duggan was travelling was stopped by police in Ferry Lane in [[Tottenham Hale]].<ref name="“Independent.co.uk">{{cite news|title=Kevin Hutchison Foster's Trial |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/mark-duggan-given-gun-just-15-minutes-before-death-8152877.html |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=Independent|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> {{Quote box |width=25% |align=right |bgcolor=#cccfff |quote= "On August 4 last year a handgun was recovered in Ferry Lane in Tottenham, north London. It had been in the possession of a man named [[Mark Duggan]]. The gun was loaded - it had a bullet in its magazine. The evidence demonstrates that that gun at that scene had been passed to Mark Duggan by this defendant, [[Kevin Hutchinson-Foster]], shortly before the [[minicab]] in which Mark Duggan was travelling was stopped by police in Ferry Lane in Tottenham Hale. There in Ferry Lane Mark Duggan was shot and fatally injured by the police as a result of his possession of that gun and what he was thought to be about to do with it. The firearm was a BBM Bruni Model 92 [[handgun]]. It had been modified so that it would fire 9mm bullets - a lethal firearm as you will hear. The charge this defendant faces is the supply or transfer of that gun to Mark Duggan." |source=— '''Edward Brown QC, Prosecutor'''.<ref name="“Independent.co.uk"/> }} Brown was also instructed in the inquest of Duggan's death.<ref name="“Inquest in the death of Mark Duggan">{{cite news|title=Inquest into Mark Duggan's death |url=https://inquestintodeathofmarkduggan.wordpress.com/tag/edward-brown-qc |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=Independent|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> He prosecuted members of the GAS (Guns And Shanks) gang from Brixton<ref name="BBC">{{cite web|title=Zac Olumegbon murder: Four teenagers jailed for life |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-16283113|publisher=BBC|accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref> who were charged with [[joint enterprise]] murder in a case of "vicious, shocking and sickening case of gang violence outside a school at a time when pupils and staff were gathering at the start of a school day",<ref name="BBC"/> as well as Ben Hitchcock's murderers, whose actions were described as "the direct result of what was a pitched battle between rival gangs."<ref name="BBCnews">{{cite news|title=Boy was killed in gang 'battle'|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/london/8071814.stm |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=BBC News|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> Co-defendant Royston Thomas was found not guilty after police detectives relaunched an investigation into the stabbing of 16-year-old Ben Hitchcock.<ref name="“BromleyTimes">{{cite news|title=Hitman Jailed For 'Medieval Turf War' Murder |url=http://www.bromleytimes.co.uk/news/wall-of-silence-scuppered-murder-trial-1-579494 |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=Bromley Times|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> He prosecuted David Jeffs known as the "Mayfair socialite murder",<ref name="“BBC London">{{cite news|title=Mayfair socialite murder: David Jeffs jailed for life|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-25322170 |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=BBC UK|date=23 July 2017}}</ref> child killer Ben Butler,<ref name="“Thisislondon.co.uk">{{cite news|title=Ben Butler murder trial: Sutton dad 'killed six-year-old daughter Ellie after conviction for assaulting her was overturned|url=http://www.thisislocallondon.co.uk/news/14436490.Ben_Butler_murder_trial__Sutton_dad__killed_six_year_old_daughter_after_conviction_for_assaulting_her_was_overturned_|accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=This Is London|date=23 July 2017|ref=Thisislocallondon.co.uk}}</ref> hitman Jamie Marsh-Smith who was found guilty of murdering a gang boss,<ref name="“SkyNews">{{cite news|title=Hitman Jailed For 'Medieval Turf War' Murder |url=http://news.sky.com/story/hitman-jailed-for-medieval-turf-war-murder-10396839 |accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=Sky News|date=23 July 2017|ref=SkyNews}}</ref> and [[MI5]] official [[Katharine Gun]] in widely publicised case involving [[MI5]] and [[GCHQ]].<ref name="“cryptome">{{cite news|title=GCHQ officer: "I leaked email to save lives" |url=https://cryptome.org/eyeball/gun-eyeball.htm |accessdate=23 July 2017|date=23 July 2017|ref=SkyNews}}</ref>
===R v Jogee=== In February 2016, Brown was interviewed by [[The Lawyer]] magazine to analyse [[R v Jogee]] that reversed previous case law on [[joint enterprise]] murder,{{Quote box|width=25%|align=left|bgcolor=#E6E6FA|quote="The appeals by these two men have been used by the Supreme Court to address the problem and change the law. Though they might well have kept the law as it was.There will now be very many cases of applications to appeal against convictions out of time. They won’t be confined to murder cases, but to all crime where there was a secondary party, so robberies, sexual crimes. That doesn’t mean every case of so-called joint enterprise will be overturned, the justices have been pretty strong on that, particularly because the Court of Appeal on accepts cases out of time when there has been a serious injustice to a party. From today it doesn’t automatically become a crime if you prove foresight by the secondary party. It’s been found too low a test to be found guilty of a serious crime, but it is still available for a jury to use in deciding whether or not the party intended to encourage or assist the other to do it."|source=— '''Edward Brown QC'''"<ref name="“The Lawyer"/>}} after a recent [[Supreme Court]] ruling indicating that it was not right that a person could be convicted of murder and subsequently sentenced to life imprisonment if they foresaw the murder could take place but did not deliver the fatal blow.<ref name="“The Lawyer">{{cite news |title=R v Jogee Ruling |url=https://l2b.thelawyer.com/kinders-casebook-landmark-ruling-reinterprets-law-of-joint-enterprise/ |accessdate=26 July 2017 |date=26 July 2017}}</ref> Brown commented: "It has always been the case that a person who intentionally assists another in a joint crime will be as guilty as the person who physically commits that crime. After the Chan Wing-Siu ruling in 1985, juries have since been directed that if a secondary party foresaw that the principal party might use a knife, for example, with intent to cause harm or murder, then they are guilty of murder as well."<ref name="“The Lawyer"/> Brown also commented that the judgment in [[R v Jogee]] and [[Ruddock v The Queen]] will have a significant effect on the prosecution of multi-handed crime, and in particular cases of multi-handed serious violence that sometimes results in death. It will also result in many applications for leave to appeal against conviction out of time.<ref name="“Lexis Nexis">{{cite news |title=Supreme Court rules on ‘joint enterprise’|url=https://www.lexisnexis.com/uk/lexispsl/corporatecrime/document/412012/5J5P-M4H1-DYW7-W245-00000-00/Supreme_Court_rules_on__joint_enterprise_ |accessdate=26 July 2017 |date=26 July 2017}}</ref>
===Kevin Hutchinson-Foster=== On 18 September 2012, Brown started prosecuting [[Kevin Hutchinson-Foster]] whose trial took place in Snaresbrook Crown Court.<ref name="“Independent UK">{{cite news |title=Mark Duggan 'given gun just 15 minutes before death' |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/mark-duggan-given-gun-just-15-minutes-before-death-8152877.html%3famp |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Duggan was shot dead while police officers were trying to arrest him in Tottenham, north London last August.<ref name="“Independent News">{{cite news |title=Police feared Mark Duggan was about to open fire |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/crime/police-marksmen-who-shot-mark-duggan-dead-feared-he-was-about-to-open-fire-court-told-8152495.html%3famp |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> The jury heard that the handgun allegedly supplied by Hutchinson-Foster was found near the spot where Duggan was shot.<ref name="“ITV News">{{cite news |title=Man guilty of supplying Duggan gun' |url=http://www.itv.com/news/london/2013-01-31/man-guilty-of-supplying-duggan-gun/ |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Giving evidence, Hutchinson-Foster who was accused of passing the gun to [[Mark Duggan]], claimed Duggan already had a gun.<ref name="“Sky News">{{cite news |title=Mark Duggan had a gun |url=https://www.news.sky.com/story/amp/tottenham-riots-mark-duggan-had-loaded-gun-10469685 |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Hutchinson-Foster is accused of "selling or transferring" a BBM Bruni Model 92 handgun to Duggan contrary to the [[Firearms Act 1968]], between 28 July and 5 August 2011.<ref name="“Sky News"/> Hutchinson-Foster was found guilty of suppying gun to Duggan. Chief Supt Dean Haydon, from the [[Metropolitan Police|Metropolitan Police's]] [[Trident Gang Crime Command|Trident]] Serious Crime Command, said: {{quote|The Kevin Hutchinson-Foster trial has primarily been about the supply of an illegal firearm and I welcome the verdict of the jury in this case today.<ref name="“BBC.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Mark Duggan shooting: Hutchinson-Foster guilty of supplying gun |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-21176207 |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref>}}
===Shanks and Guns gang=== In 2011 Brown prosecuted two south London gangs known as Shanks and Guns, or SG, and the Black Mafia, also known as the Sydenham Boys.<ref name="“NewsShopper">{{cite news|title=Is Nicholas Pearton another victim of south London gang rivalry? |url=http://www.newsshopper.co.uk/news/8905191.Is_Nicholas_Pearton_another_victim_of_south_London_gang_rivalry_/ |accessdate=25 July 2017| date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Gang members were found guilty of murder of Nicholas "Nick" Pearton who was thought to be their friend. In May 2011 Pearton, 17 year old schoolboy, was stabbed by gangsters being caught up in a clash between two gangs in Home Park, [[Sydenham]].<ref name="“BBC News">{{cite news|title=Three youths have been found guilty of murdering a 16-year-old boy who was chased through a park and stabbed to death in south-east London |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-12701537|accessdate=25 July 2017 |publisher=BBC |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Pearton was attacked when he went to the park to help gangsters who he thought were his friends, after receiving a call from them.<ref name="“DailyMail">{{cite news |title=Shaking hands in celebration on a bus, thugs who had just hunted down a schoolboy, 16, like a pack of animals and stabbed him to death |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2022508/Seven-youths-labelled-pack-animals-given-total-74-years-prison-murder-schoolboy-16.html |accessdate=25 July 2017 |publisher=Daily Mail|date=25 July 2017}}</ref> The jury at the [[Old Bailey]] saw CCTV footage from the [[KFC|Kentucky Fried Chicken shop]] of an injured Nicholas running in and collapsing.<ref name="“EveningStandard">{{cite news |title=Boy stabbed in heart ‘by killers in school blazers’ |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/boy-stabbed-in-heart-by-killers-in-school-blazers-6552329.html%3famp |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Prosecuting, Brown commented that Pearton was "the only white-skinned male participant in the incident"<ref name="“Express">{{cite news |title=A 16-year-old boy was hounded and killed in a park by a gang of schoolchildren, the Old Bailey heard. |url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/221549/Stabbed-boy-was-chased-by-gang/amp |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> when he was chased and eventually killed by a pack of "animals."<ref name="“Express"/> The court heard that hours earlier, Pearton's so-called friend, a member of Black Mafia gang known as the Sydenham Boys, had been involved in a row at school which led to a confrontation in the park between the two gangs.<ref name="“Independent">{{cite news |title=Three youths face life sentences after being found guilty today of murdering schoolboy Nicholas Pearton |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/youths-face-life-for-boys-murder-2238119.html%3famp |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Brown told the jury: {{quote|Moments after Pearton arrived at the park, his so-called friends had evaporated and he was left to face the attackers on his own. In the eyes of the attackers however, he remained a member of the rival Black Mafia gang.<ref name="“BromleyOnline">{{cite news|title=Nick Pearton’s Bromley Greenwich killers jailed |url=http://www.bromleytimes.co.uk/news/nick-pearton-s-bromley-greenwich-killers-jailed-1-985975 |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref>}} Pearton's father said he suffers ‘overwhelming guilt’ and ‘emptiness’ since his son's murder.<ref name="“BBC Online">{{cite news |title=Nicholas Pearton park stabbing: Gang detained for death |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-14400876 |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Only one out of ten gangsters was identified as stabbing Pearton. The others claimed they had been wrongly convicted of murder and manslaughter. Belgian national Edward Conteh was convicted of Pearton's murder and deported after his conviction under [[joint enterprise law]], whilst not being present at the scene.<ref name="Guardian Online">{{cite news |title=Edward Conteh was convicted of a murder he didn’t even see |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/oct/04/edward-conteh-joint-enterprise |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> But Judge Anthony Morris said they had all taken part in "a terrifying example of gang violence".<ref name="“EastLondonOnline">{{cite news |title=Nicholas Pearton park stabbing: Gang detained for death |url=http://www.eastlondonlines.co.uk/2011/01/jury-see-dramatic-last-moments-of-sydenham-stabbing-victim/ |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Morris also said not enough was being done to raise awareness of the consequences of [[gang violence]].<ref name="“BBC Online"/> When the police commented that they already had a programme, Judge Morris said: {{quote|It seems to me the message is not getting through to them and that we are not addressing a major issue.<ref name="“BBC Online"/>}}
===R v Hanad Mohammed=== In 2016 Brown started prosecuting Hamad Mohammad and three of his associates who were accused of [[joint enterprise|joint enterprise murder]]. Ionut Lazar, 28, was found shot dead in Shepherd’s Bush on 22 October 2016 two days after arriving in the UK from Romania.<ref name="“Old Bailey">{{cite news |title=CASES OF INTEREST AT THE OLD BAILEY ON THURSDAY, AUGUST 3 |url=https://old-bailey.com/old-bailey-cases-of-interest |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Lazar, 28, was killed after “a number of men” forced their way into a home in [[Shepherd's Bush]], west London<ref name="“Express088756">{{cite news |title=Romanian shot dead in hometown days after arriving in the UK |url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/725273/shooting-Shepards-Bush-London-Askew-road-killed-Romanian-Ionut-Lazar |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Police were called to Askew Road, W11 on 22 October at 2.40am to reports of an unconscious male at a residential property in Askew Road. Lazar was found suffering from what was initially thought to be a stab wound to the chest.<ref name="“Getwestlondon.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Police investigating Shepherd's Bush murder of Ionut Lazar appeal for help tracing two men |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/news/west-london-news/police-investigating-shepherds-bush-murder-12909979 |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> He died at the scene a short while later. A post-mortem examination took place October 24 at Fulham Mortuary and established the cause of death as a bullet wound to the chest. <ref name="“Publicnow99765">{{cite news |title=Metropolitan Police: Further Arrest Re Shepherd's Bush Murder|url=http://www.publicnow.com/view/E069EA8A09E6004F897F406990E67A578AE883D7?2016-11-18-22:31:57+00:00-xxx9637 |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref>
===Gintare Suminaite=== In January 2017 Brown prosecuted Gintare Suminaite, 29-year-old mother from [[Crawley]], [[West Sussex]], who was charged with murder of her newborn child.<ref name="“Metro 1">{{cite news |title=‘Tragic’ mother who killed her baby is spared jail |url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/01/31/tragic-mother-who-killed-her-baby-is-spared-jail-6416647/ |accessdate=25 July 2017 |date=25 July 2017}}</ref> Prosecuting, Brown told the jury that the child was the product of Suminaite's secret affair with a fellow Lithuanian.<ref name="“Express 1">{{cite news |title=Mum who strangled newborn baby to death with knickers after giving birth WALKS FREE |url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/761381/Mum-who-strangled-baby-to-death-walks-free-from-court |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Suminaite kept her pregnancy hidden from authorities and her long-term partner, with whom she already had a young child.<ref name="“BBC News 1">{{cite news |title=Bognor Regis mother Gintare Suminaite admits killing baby |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-sussex-38395332 |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> She attended a hearing at Crawley magistrates' court but did not enter a plea to the murder charge.<ref name="“Independent 1">{{cite news |title=Mother charged with murdering newborn baby girl |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/mother-charged-with-murdering-newborn-baby-girl-a6977251.html |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Suminaite told police she "most likely" intended to kill her baby, but said she did not know why. At the trial held at the Old Bailey she pleaded guilty to a charge of infanticide.<ref name="“Express 1"/> The court heard that on April 5, 2016, Suminaite left work early saying she had ‘big problems’ and gave birth in the bathroom at home, with her partner in another room.<ref name="“IifeNews">{{cite news |title=Woman Who Killed Her Newborn Baby Girl Minutes After Birth Won’t Go to Prison |url=http://www.lifenews.com/2017/02/01/woman-who-killed-her-newborn-baby-girl-minutes-after-birth-wont-go-to-prison/ |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Her partner found Suminaite lying naked in the bathroom surrounded by blood and a baby bath full of what appeared to be clothes.<ref name="“The Argus">{{cite news |title=High Court judge may be called in to hear baby death case |url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/news/14423777.High_Court_judge_may_be_called_in_to_hear_baby_death_case/ |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Jurors at the Old Bailey heard that Suminaite was bleeding and pale when found by her boyfriend who eventually called an ambulance after she confessed what had happened.<ref name="“The Conversation">{{cite news |title=Murder or infanticide? Understanding the causes behind the most shocking of crimes |url=http://theconversation.com/murder-or-infanticide-understanding-the-causes-behind-the-most-shocking-of-crimes-79808 |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> The court heard that the child lay undiscovered as medics initially did not spot the body in the baby bath and the couple did not mention it.<ref name="“15min.t">{{cite news |title=Anglijoje savo naujagimę pasmaugusi lietuvė |url=http://www.15min.lt/naujiena/aktualu/emigrantai/anglijoje-savo-naujagime-pasmaugusi-lietuve-i-kalejima-neses-592-748420 |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Suminaite was subsequently treated in hospital for significant blood loss and injury from childbirth.<ref name="“Elite Daily">{{cite news |title=Mom Who Strangled Baby To Death Avoids Jail For Being ‘Overwhelmed' By Stress |url=http://elitedaily.com/news/mom-who-strangled-baby-avoids-jail/1773766/ |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Following her arrest, Suminaite said she strangled her baby with her [[lingerie]], but did not know why. She described giving birth quickly and easily and said the baby was moving and trying to cry.<ref name="“Court News UK">{{cite news |title=MUM WHO STRANGLED NEWBORN BABY WITH HER KNICKERS SPARED JAIL |url=http://courtnewsuk.co.uk/mum-strangled-newborn-baby-knickers-spared-jail |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Suminaite told the jury she cut the umbilical cord with a razor then passed out in the bath.<ref name="“delfi.lt">{{cite news |title=Lietuvė Anglijoje įtariama kraupiu nusikaltimu |url=http://www.delfi.lt/news/daily/crime/lietuve-anglijoje-itariama-kraupiu-nusikaltimu.d?id=70945932 |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> When she came to pick the baby up, she said the baby was not moving and she tied a pair of her knickers around her neck and put her in the baby bath.<ref name="“Court News UK"/> She said she did not know why she did it as she had no mental problems.<ref name="“evoke.ie">{{cite news |title=Mother who murdered baby with pair of knickers avoids jail |url=http://evoke.ie/news/world/mother-who-murdered-baby-with-pair-of-knickers-escapes-jail |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> Emergency services were called to her home on Aldwick Road in [[Bognor]].<ref name="“Spirit FM">{{cite news |title=Court Date Set For Woman Charged With Baby's Murder |url=https://www.spiritfm.net/news/sussex-news/2082058/court-date-set-for-woman-charged-with-babys-murder |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> At the hearing, Mr Justice Nicol said that Suminaite's circumstances were "tragic in themselves".<ref name="“Metro 1"/> Sentencing Suminaite, he said: {{quote|The unlawful homicide of anyone is a tragedy, especially in the case when the victim is so young, even more so that is the case when the child dies at the hands of her mother. However, your own circumstances were tragic in themselves and that is reflected in the nature of the offence to which you have pleaded guilty. You were overwhelmed by the stress of your situation and in a state of partial denial during the pregnancy. At the time of giving birth your were in a state of extreme anxiety and panic amounting to a temporary impairment of the balance of your mind.<ref name="“Metro 1"/>}} Suminaite followed proceedings with the aid of a translator as [[English language|English]] was not her first language.<ref name="“MailOnline 2">{{cite news |title=Mother, 29, appears in court accused of murdering her baby daughter just minutes after she was born |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3534332/Mother-court-accused-murdering-baby-daughter.html#ixzz4ongGOwPS |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> In his closing speech Brown acknowledged that Suminaite been emotionally and socially isolated during her life in England. He told the court: {{Quote box |width=40% |align=left |bgcolor=#FFB6C1 |quote= "Of course I have to acknowledge there is a child who has had its life extinguished within minutes of birth at the hands of its mother. But the young mother responsible was not only socially isolated, but emotionally isolated too." |source=— '''Edward Brown QC, Prosecutor'''.<ref name="“DailyNews">{{cite news |title=Mum strangled BABY girl to death minutes after giving birth in the bathroom |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/572503/Baby-Strangle-Killer-infanticide-Gintare-Suminaite-Baby-Old-Bailey-Bognor-West-Sussex |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref>}} Suminaite was sentenced to a 24-month community order with a rehabilitation requirement order.<ref name="“Mirror 1">{{cite news |title=‘Tragic’ mother who killed her baby is spared jail |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/woman-who-strangled-newborn-baby-9724931 |accessdate=4 August 2017 |date=4 August 2017}}</ref> At the completion of the trial Mr Justice Nicol said: {{quote|The courts recognise in circumstances such as this, where there is no underlying psychiatric illness, where there is a low risk of re-offending or causing harm, that what might otherwise be thought of as lenient is the appropriate course, namely a non-custodial sentence.<ref name="“Mirror 1"/>}}
===Jason Marshall=== In August 2017, Brown prosecuted male escort Jason Marshall who murdered his client Peter Fasoli who he met in December 2012 through gay social networking site called [[Badoo]], where he advertised his services under his "working" name Gabriel. Marshall was arrested after the victim's relative found hidden footage of killing on his [[laptop]].<ref name="Metro.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Computer repairman ‘terrorised and killed by fake policeman during bondage |url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/07/31/computer-repairman-terrorised-and-killed-by-fake-policeman-during-bondage-6818943/ |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> Peter Fasoli, a 58-year-old [[IT]] expert,<ref name="Attitude.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Jason Marshall, 28, is accused of killing IT expert Peter Fasoli during a hook-up before setting his flat alight. |url=http://attitude.co.uk/nephew-found-footage-of-uncles-hook-up-app-murder-two-years-after-believing-he-died-in-fire/ |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> from [[Northolt]] was terrorised and murdered in 2013 at his own house by Marshall who posed as a policeman.<ref name="London Telegraph">{{cite news |title=Murder suspect caught after victim's relative finds hidden footage of killing |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/07/31/murder-suspect-caught-victims-relative-finds-hidden-footage/ |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> On the opening day of his trial at the [[Old Bailey]], Marshall was described as a "calculating and determined" killer.<ref name="DailyRecord.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Jason Marshall, 28, calmly stood over the body of Peter Fasoli and pronounced "in the name of the father, the son and the Holy Ghost" in Latin. |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/no-no-please-court-hears-10907646 |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> Prosecuting, Mr Brown warned jurors that they would be asked to view the video, which showed the actual killing itself.<ref name="London DailyMail.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Computer repairman filmed his own death as fantasist, 28, terrorised and murdered him during a bondage session while listening to Classic FM |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4746834/Fantasist-killer-caught-camera-murdering-partner.html |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> The court heard that during sexual roleplay, Marshall stripped the victim and arrested him for “being a spy” and hacking into a government laptop, the court heard. Fasoli was threatened with a knife and forced to hand over his cash card pin numbers.<ref name="BBC London">{{cite news |title=Man 'murdered by fake policeman in sex game' |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-40779337 |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> The footage shower Marshall, 28, calmly standing over the body of his client Peter Fasoli and signing "in the name of the father, the son and the Holy Ghost" in Latin, after killing him. Marshall subsequently set fire to Fasoli's home in attempt to make Fasoli's death look like an accident.<ref name="“Standard.co.uk">{{cite news |title=A "fantasist" killer was caught on camera murdering his lover during a bondage sex session set to Classic FM before torching his home to cover-up the crime, the Old Bailey heard |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/crime/fantasist-killer-caught-on-camera-murdering-partner-during-bondage-session-set-to-classic-fm-a3600361.html |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> {{Quote box |width=25% |align=right |bgcolor=#FFE4B5 |quote= "The fire, in the early hours of January 7, 2013, had been intended to hide a terrible crime. The fire was set by this defendant in an attempt to disguise what truly happened, and the defendant Jason Marshall very nearly succeeded in escaping justice. Peter Fasoli was killed, intentionally. He had been subjected to a calculated and determined attack, by this defendant whom he invited into his home. In the end he literally fought for his life but by the time Mr Fasoli fully understood the true motives of the person who had tricked his way into his home, it was too late. Desperate as his attempts were, he could do nothing - as you will all too graphically come to understand." |source=— '''Edward Brown QC, Prosecutor'''.<ref name="“Standard.co.uk"/> }} But two years later when Fasoli's nephew was sorting through his belongings, he was horrified to discover a computer file containing [[CCTV]] footage of the entire event.<ref name="ITV News">{{cite news |title=28-year-old on trial for 2013 Northolt murder |url=http://www.itv.com/news/london/2017-07-31/28-year-old-on-trial-for-2013-northolt-murder/ |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> The court heard how Marshall, who denied murder, first got in contact with Peter Fasoli in December 2012 through gay social networking site called [[Badoo]], inviting to set up a treesome and inventing the persona of a policeman.<ref name="NewhamRecorder">{{cite news |title=East Ham murder accused ‘set fire to victim’s home to cover up death’, court hears |url=http://www.newhamrecorder.co.uk/news/crime-court/east-ham-murder-accused-set-fire-to-victim-s-home-to-cover-up-death-court-hears-1-5129121 |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> Prosecuting, Mr Brown told jurors: {{quote|There is a telling feature of this case - whilst the defendant sought to tempt the deceased into thinking their encounter that night was to be sexual in nature, the sexual element of the night’s events played only a short part early on and soon was superseded by physical domination and then violence.<ref name="NewhamRecorder"/>}} The Old Baily heard that Marshall arrived at the Fasoli's home at around 7pm on 6 January 2012, pretending to be a police officer kitted out with a police utility belt, handcuffs and a pistol holster.<ref name="London Independent">{{cite news |title=Murder victim inadvertently filmed his own death during bondage sex game |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/bondage-sex-game-murder-victim-film-death-peter-fasoli-london-northolt-fake-policeman-classic-fm-a7871291.html?amp |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> During sexual role play, Marshall stripped the victim and arrested him for “being a spy” and hacking into a Government laptop, the court heard.<ref name="DailyRecord">{{cite news |title='No! No! Please!' court hears bound man pleaded for life before being smothered to death by fake cop in sex role play game |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/no-no-please-court-hears-10907646 |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> After Marshall fled the scene, he sent a “calculated and cynical” message to Fasoli on the Badoo chat line apologising for not seeing him the night before.<ref name="CourtNewsUK">{{cite news |title='No! No! Please!' court hears bound man pleaded for life before being smothered to death by fake cop in sex role play game |url=http://courtnewsuk.co.uk/trial-accused-pensioner-killer/ |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> He withdrew £750 in cash from the Fasoli's bank account and used his card to buy a flight to Rome.<ref name="Times Online">{{cite news |title=Classic FM ‘sex killer’ caught on video |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/classic-fm-sex-killer-caught-on-video-q8smpsc9h |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> In February 2016 Marshal was arrested in Italy and [[extradition|extradited]]<ref name="Ealing today">{{cite news |title=James Marshall extradited from Italy to be tried for the murder of Peter Fasoli |url=http://www.ealingtoday.co.uk/default.asp?section=info&page=concrime089.htm |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> to [[United Kingdom]] to face trial for murder of Fasoli he committed four years ago.<ref name="Express.co.uk News">{{cite news |title=Prisoner extradited from Italy and charged with a murder four years ago |url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/768077/Prisoner-extradited-Italy-charged-murder-four-years-ago-Norwich-Jason-Marshall/amp |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> A [[Metropolitan Police]] spokesman commented: {{quote|Detectives investigating the murder of a man in Northolt in 2013 have arrested and charged a man on suspicion of his murder. He will appear in custody at [[Hendon]] [[Magistrates' Court]] today. The investigation into Mr Fasoli's murder was started on 10 November 2014 by officers from the [[Homicide and Serious Crime Command]], after new evidence was passed to the [[Metropolitan Police Service|MPS]]. Mr Fasoli, aged 58, died on Monday, 7 January 2013 after he was brought out of his burning flat in Rubens Road, Northolt.<ref name="Express.co.uk News"/>}} The court has heard that Fasoli accidentally filmed his own [[bondage (BDSM)|bondage]] sex session murder at the hands of Jason Marshall dressed as policeman. Jurors at the Old Bailey watched footage of Fasoli begging for his life as he was attacked by fantasist Marshall while classical music played in the background.<ref name="Express.co.uk News"/> Camera footage showed Fasioli becoming visibly distressed as he was gagged and bound on his bed.<ref name="Europe Breaking News">{{cite news |title=Computer repairman ‘accidentally filmed own bondage session murder at hands of fake cop’ |url=https://www.europebreakingnews.net/2017/07/computer-repairman-accidentally-filmed-own-bondage-session-murder-at-hands-of-fake-cop |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=July 2017}}</ref> He was threatened with a large hunting knife and forced to hand over his cash card pin numbers, the court heard.<ref name="MurderMap.co.uk">{{cite news |title=Northolt Fire: Peter Fasoli |url=http://www.murdermap.co.uk/pages/cases/case.asp?CID=927080780&Case=Northolt-Fire:-Peter-Fasoli |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=1 August 2017}}</ref> Prosecuting, Brown told the jury: {{quote|Fasoli's postmortem examination initially gave the cause of death as inhalation of fire [[Combustion gas|fumes]], but a re-examination found that Fasoli was still alive when the fire was set. Restraint and asphyxia also contributed to Fasoli's death.<ref name="Guardian 2">{{cite news |title=Man accused of murder during sex session challenged over 'no memory' claim |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/aug/04/jason-marshall-accused-murder-during-sex-session-challenged-over-no-memory-claim |accessdate=1 August 2017 |date=July 2017}}</ref>}}
The court heard that during psychological evaluation Marshall told the psychiatrists that he is an incarnation of [[Archangel Gabriel]] and stated “You can’t judge me, only God can judge me.”<ref name="Independent 09">{{cite news |title=Marshall, who has told psychiatrists that he is an incarnation of the Archangel Gabriel|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/jason-peter-marshall-british-man-charged-with-stabbing-and-strangling-italian-retiree-he-met-in-gay-9226645.html%3famp |accessdate= 15 March 2018 |date=15 March 2018}}</ref> In September 2017 Jason Marshall was imprisoned for 39 years for the murder of Peter Fasoli.<ref name="telegraph61">{{cite news |title=Sadistic killer caught on camera torturing victim jailed for at least 39 years |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/09/26/sadistic-killer-caught-camera-torturing-victim-jailed-least/ |accessdate=15 October 2017 |date=15 October 2017}}</ref> He has previously been convicted in the UK of impersonating [[MI5]] and transport police officials while carrying out searches and of issuing fines on the Tube.<ref name="Independent 09" />
==Trusteeships and patronages== In 2011 Brown became a [[trustee]] of the Growing Against Violence, charity that delivers programmes in schools that address gang exploitation and seeks to educate young people and draw them away from gangs and violence.<ref name="GOV">{{cite web|title=Edward Brown lectures young gang members on the consequences of joint enterprise gang violence.|url=http://growingagainstviolence.org.uk/board/ |publisher=Young Legal Aid Lawyers|accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref> Brown also gave lectures to young south London gang members on law of [[joint enterprise]] and on the dangers of [[gang violence]].<ref name="GOV"/>
==Notable appearances== ===Guilty by Association=== In September 2015 Brown, in his capacity of Senior Tresury Counsel, appeared on Guity by Association, [[BBC One]] [[documentary]] that examines law of [[joint enterprise]].<ref name="“BBC Channel One">{{cite news |title=Guilty By Association |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/proginfo/2014/27/guilty-by-association |accessdate=26 July 2017 |date=26 July 2017}}</ref> The programme raised questions about how the courts deal with gang violence, what constitutes a murder and whether young people are being sentenced for crimes they did not commit.<ref name="“BBC Channel One"/> Documentary follows Alex and his family as he is charged under the joint enterprise law and examines the increasing controversy surrounding the details of this law which some believe is creating criminals of the innocent.<ref name="“BBC Channel One"/>

{{Infobox scientist | name = Edward William Felten | image = Edward-Felten-at-Princeton-CITP.jpg | image_size = 200px | caption = Edward Felten at [[Princeton University]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1963|03|25}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | residence = [[Princeton, New Jersey]] | citizenship = [[United States|American]] | field = [[Computer Science]]
[[Public administration|public affairs]] | work_institutions = [[Princeton University]], [[Federal Trade Commission]] | alma_mater = [[California Institute of Technology]]
[[University of Washington]] | doctoral_advisor = [[Edward D. Lazowska]] and John Zahorjan | doctoral_students = | known_for = [[Secure Digital Music Initiative]] | prizes = [[EFF Pioneer Award]][https://w2.eff.org/news/archives/2005_04.php#003496 Electronic Frontier Foundation Announces Pioneer Award Winners] EFF, 2005 | religion = | footnotes = }} '''Edward William Felten''' (born March 25, 1963) is a professor of [[computer science]] and [[Public administration|public affairs]] at [[Princeton University]]. On November 4, 2010, he was named Chief Technologist for the [[Federal Trade Commission]],http://www.ftc.gov/opa/2010/11/cted.shtm a position he officially assumed January 3, 2011. On May 11, 2015, he was named the Deputy U.S. Chief Technology Officer.https://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2015/05/11/white-house-names-dr-ed-felten-deputy-us-chief-technology-officer Felten has done a variety of [[computer security]] research, including groundbreaking work on proof-carrying authentication and work on security related to the [[Java (programming language)|Java programming language]], but he is perhaps best known for his paper on the [[Secure Digital Music Initiative]] (SDMI) challenge. ==Biography== Felten attended the [[California Institute of Technology]] and graduated with a degree in [[Physics]] in 1985. He worked as a staff programmer at Caltech from 1986 to 1989 on a parallel supercomputer project at Caltech. He then enrolled as a graduate student in Computer Science at the [[University of Washington]]. He was awarded a [[Master of Science]] degree in 1991 and a [[Ph.D]] in 1993. His Ph.D. thesis was on developing an automated protocol for communication between parallel processors. In 1993, he joined the faculty of [[Princeton University]] in the Department of Computer Science as an Assistant Professor. He was promoted to Associate Professor in 1999 and to Professor in 2003. In 2006, he joined the [[Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs]], but computer science remains his home department. In 2005, he became the Director of the [http://citp.princeton.edu Center for Information and Technology Policy] at [[Princeton University|Princeton]]. He has served as a consultant to law firms, corporations, private foundations, and government agencies. His research involves computer security, and technology policy.{{cite web | url = http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~felten/FeltenCV.pdf |format=PDF| title = Edward Felten's Curriculum Vitae | accessdate = 2008-05-19 | last = Felten | first = Edward | authorlink = Edward Felten }} He lives in [[Princeton, New Jersey]] with his family. From 2006 to 2010, he was a member of the board of the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]] (EFF). In 2007, he was inducted as a Fellow of the [[Association for Computing Machinery]]. In November 2010, he was named Chief Technologist of the [[Federal Trade Commission]].{{cite web | url = http://ftc.gov/opa/2010/11/cted.shtm | title = FTC Names Edward W. Felten as Agency's Chief Technologist; Eileen Harrington as Executive Director | date = 2010-11-04 | publisher = [[Federal Trade Commission]] | accessdate = 2010-11-04 }} On May 11, 2015, he was named Deputy U.S. Chief Technology Officer for [[The White House]].{{cite web | url = https://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2015/05/11/white-house-names-dr-ed-felten-deputy-us-chief-technology-officer | title = The White House Names Dr. Ed Felten as Deputy U.S. Chief Technology Officer | date = 2015-05-11 | publisher = [[The White House]] | accessdate = 2015-05-11 }} ==''United States v. Microsoft''== Felten was a witness for the United States government in ''[[United States v. Microsoft]]'', where the software company was charged with committing a variety of antitrust crimes. During the trial, Microsoft's attorneys denied that it was possible to remove the [[Internet Explorer]] web browser from a [[Windows 98]] equipped computer without significantly impairing the operation of Windows. Citing research he had undertaken with Christian Hicks and Peter Creath, two of his former students,{{cite web | url = http://www.thestandard.com/article/0,1902,24020,00.html | title = Security Code-Cracking Professor Pulls 'How-To' Paper | accessdate = 2007-05-07 | last = Wasserman | first = Elizabeth | date = April 26, 2001 | publisher = [[The Industry Standard]] }} Felten testified that it was possible to remove Internet Explorer functionality from Windows without causing any problems with the operating system. He demonstrated his team's tool in court, showing 19 ways in which it is normally possible to access the web browser from the Windows platform that his team's tool rendered inaccessible. Microsoft argued that Felten's changes did not truly remove Internet Explorer but only made its functionality inaccessible to the end user by removing icons, shortcuts and the iexplore.exe executable file, and making changes to the system registry. This led to a debate as to what exactly constitutes the "web browser," since much of the core functionality of Internet Explorer is stored in a shared [[dynamic-link library]], accessible to any program running under Windows. Microsoft also argued that Felten's tool did not even completely remove web-browsing capability from the system since it was still possible to access the web through other Windows executables besides iexplore.exe, such as the Windows help system. ==The SDMI challenge== As part of a contest in 2000, [[SDMI]] (Secure Digital Music Initiative) invited researchers and others to try to break the [[digital audio]] [[steganography|watermark]] technologies that they had devised. In a series of individual challenges, the participants were given a sample audio piece, with one of the watermarks embedded. If the participants sent back the sample with the watermark removed (and with less than an acceptable amount of [[signal loss]], though this condition was not stated by SDMI), they would win that particular challenge. Felten was an initial participant of the contest. He chose to opt out of [[confidentiality]] agreements that would have made his team eligible for the cash prize. Despite being given very little or no information about the watermarking technologies other than the audio samples and having only three weeks to work with them, Felten and his team managed to modify the files sufficiently that SDMI's automated judging system declared the watermark removed. SDMI did not accept that Felten had successfully broken the watermark according to the rules of the contest, noting that there was a requirement for files to lose no sound quality. SDMI claimed that the automated judging result was inconclusive, as a submission which simply wiped all the sounds off the file would have successfully removed the watermark but would not meet the quality requirement. ===SDMI lawsuits=== Felten's team developed a scientific paper explaining the methods used by his team in defeating the SDMI watermarks. Planning to present the paper at the Fourth International [[Information Hiding]] Workshop of 2001 in [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]], Felten was threatened with legal action by SDMI,{{cite web | url = https://www.eff.org/IP/DMCA/Felten_v_RIAA/20010409_riaa_sdmi_letter.html | title = RIAA/SDMI Legal Threat Letter | accessdate = 2007-05-07 | last = Oppenheim | first = Matthew J. | date = April 9, 2001 | publisher = [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]] }} the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA), and [http://verance.com Verance Corporation], under the terms of the [[DMCA]], on the argument that one of the technologies his team had broken was currently in use in the market. Felten withdrew the presentation from the workshop, reading a brief statement about the threats instead. SDMI and other copyright holders denied that they had ever threatened to sue Felten. However, SDMI appears to have threatened legal action when spokesman Matt Oppenheim warned Felten in a letter that "any disclosure of information gained from participating in the Public Challenge....could subject you and your research team to actions under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act.".{{cite web | url = https://www.theregister.co.uk/2001/04/23/sdmi_cracks_revealed/ | title = SDMI cracks revealed | accessdate = 2007-05-07 | last = Greene | first = Thomas C. | date = April 23, 2001 | work = Security | publisher = [[The Register]] }} Felten, with help from the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]], sued the groups, requesting a [[declaratory judgement]] ruling that their publication of the paper would be legal. The case was dismissed for a [[Standing (law)|lack of standing]].{{cite web | url = https://www.eff.org/IP/DMCA/Felten_v_RIAA/20011128_hearing_transcript.html | title = Final Hearing Transcript, Felten v. RIAA | accessdate = 2007-05-07 | date = November 28, 2001 | publisher = [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]] }} Felten presented his paper at the [[USENIX]] security conference in 2001. The [[United States Department of Justice]] has offered Felten and other researchers assurances that the DMCA does not threaten their work and stated that the legal threats against them were invalid. ==Sony rootkit investigation== The [[2005 Sony BMG CD copy protection scandal]] started when security researcher [[Mark Russinovich]] revealed on October 31, 2005 that Sony's [[Extended Copy Protection]] ("XCP") [[copy protection]] software on the CD ''[[Get Right with the Man]]'' by [[Van Zant]] contained hidden files that could damage the operating system, install [[spyware]] and make the user's computer vulnerable to attack when the CD was played on a Microsoft Windows-based PC. Sony then released a software patch to remove XCP. On November 15, 2005, Felten and [[J. Alex Halderman]] showed that Sony's method for removing XCP copy protection software from the computer makes it more vulnerable to attack, as it essentially installed a [[rootkit]], in the form of an [[Active X]] control used by the uninstaller, and left it on the user's machine and set so as to allow any web page visited by the user to execute arbitrary code. Felten and Halderman described the problem in a blog post:
The consequences of the flaw are severe, it allows any Web page you visit to download, install, and run any code it likes on your computer. Any Web page can seize control of your computer; then it can do anything it likes. That's about as serious as a security flaw can get.{{cite web | url = http://www.freedom-to-tinker.com/?p=927 | title = Sony’s Web-Based Uninstaller Opens a Big Security Hole; Sony to Recall Discs | accessdate = 2007-05-07 | last = Felten | first = Edward | authorlink = Edward Felten |author2=Alex Halderman | date = November 15, 2005 | publisher = Freedom to Tinker }}
==Diebold voting machine analysis== On September 13, 2006, Felten and graduate students Ariel Feldman and [[Alex Halderman]] discovered severe security flaws in a Diebold Election Systems (now [[Premier Election Solutions]]) [[voting machine]]. Their findings claimed, "Malicious software running on a single voting machine can steal votes with little if any risk of detection. The malicious software can modify all of the records, audit logs, and counters kept by the voting machine, so that even careful forensic examination of these records will find nothing amiss."{{cite journal |author1 = Ariel J. Feldman |author2 = J. Alex Halderman |author3 = Edward W. Felten |title = Security Analysis of the Diebold AccuVote-TS Voting Machine |version = |publisher = [[Princeton University]] |date = September 13, 2006 |url = http://itpolicy.princeton.edu/voting/ts-paper.pdf |format = PDF |accessdate = 2007-05-07 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070513135051/http://itpolicy.princeton.edu/voting/ts-paper.pdf |archivedate = May 13, 2007 |df = }} ==Sequoia voting machine analysis== In early 2008, New Jersey election officials announced that they planned to send one or more [[Sequoia Voting Systems|Sequoia]] Advantage voting machines to Ed Felten and [[Andrew Appel]] (also of Princeton University) for analysis. In March 2008, Sequoia sent an e-mail to Professor Felten asserting that allowing him to examine Sequoia voting machines would violate the license agreement between Sequoia and the county which bought them, and also that Sequoia would take legal action "to stop [...] any non-compliant analysis, [...] publication of Sequoia software, its behavior, reports regarding same or any other infringement of our intellectual property." {{cite web |url=http://www.freedom-to-tinker.com/?p=1265 |title=Interesting e-mail by Sequoia |publisher= |author=Ed Felten |date=2008-03-17 }} This action sparked outrage among computer technology activists.{{cite web |url=http://www.techdirt.com/articles/20080317/185348564.shtml |title=E-Voting Firm Threatens Ed Felten If He Reviews Its E-Voting Machine |publisher=[[Techdirt]] |date=2008-03-18 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.boingboing.net/2008/03/17/sequoia-voting-syste.html |title=Sequoia Voting Systems threatens Felten's Princeton security research team |publisher=[[BoingBoing]] |author=[[Cory Doctorow]] |date=2008-03-17 }} After examining Sequoia's machines, Felten and Appel indeed discovered grave problems with the accuracy of the machines.Ed Felten: [http://freedom-to-tinker.com/blog/felten/nj-election-discrepancies-worse-previously-thought-contradict-sequoias-explanation NJ Election Discrepancies Worse Than Previously Thought, Contradict Sequoia's Explanation], ''Freedom To Tinker'', April 4th, 2008. They also demonstrated that the machines can be hacked and compromised within minutes.Andrew Appel: [http://freedom-to-tinker.com/blog/appel/security-seals-avc-advantage-voting-machines-are-easily-defeated Security Seals on AVC Advantage Voting Machines are Easily Defeated], ''Freedom To Tinker'', December 19th, 2008. Shortly after that, Sequoia's corporate Web site was hacked. The hack was first discovered by Ed Felten. Sequoia took its Web site down on 20 March and removed the "intrusive content."{{cite news|url=http://www.efluxmedia.com/news_Sequoia_Voting_Systems_Admits_To_Hackers_Attacking_Their_Website_15405.html|title=Sequoia Voting Systems Admits To Hackers Attacking Their Website|publisher=eFluxMedia|author=Dee Chisamera|date=2008-03-21|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090406084309/http://www.efluxmedia.com/news_Sequoia_Voting_Systems_Admits_To_Hackers_Attacking_Their_Website_15405.html|archivedate=2009-04-06|df=}} ==Cold boot attack== In February 2008, Felten and his students were part of the team that discovered the [[cold boot attack]], which allows someone with physical access to a computer to bypass operating system protections and extract the contents of its memory.{{cite journal|url=http://citp.princeton.edu/memory/ |title=Lest We Remember: Cold Boot Attacks on Encryption Keys |author=J. Alex Halderman, [[Seth Schoen|Seth D. Schoen]], [[Nadia Heninger]], William Clarkson, William Paul, Joseph A. Calandrino, Ariel J. Feldman, [[Jacob Appelbaum]], and Edward W. Felten |publisher=[[Princeton University]] |date=2008-02-21 |accessdate=2008-02-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722182409/http://citp.princeton.edu/memory/ |archivedate=July 22, 2011 }} ==Federal Trade Commission== In November 2010, Felten was named the first Chief Technologist of the [[Federal Trade Commission]],{{cite news| url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/posttech/2010/11/ftc_names_internet_security_an.html | work=The Washington Post | title=FTC names Princeton computer security expert as first chief technologist}} for which he took a one-year leave of absence from Princeton University.http://thehill.com/blogs/hillicon-valley/personnel-notes/127705-princeton-prof-edward-felten-named-ftcs-first-chief-technologist ==Awards== * [[National Academy of Engineering]] (2013) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * [http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~felten/ Edward W. {{Infobox basketball biography | name = Enes Kanter | image = Enes Kanter (cropped).jpg | caption = Kanter with the Knicks in March 2018 | imagesize = | position = [[Center (basketball)|Center]] | height_ft = 6 | height_in = 11 | weight_lb = 250 | league = [[National Basketball Association|NBA]] | team = New York Knicks | number = 00 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1992|5|20}} | birth_place = [[Zürich]], Switzerland | nationality = Turkish | high_school = Stoneridge Preparatory School
([[Simi Valley, California]]) | draft_year = 2011 | draft_round = 1 | draft_pick = 3 | draft_team = [[Utah Jazz]] | career_start = 2008 | career_end = | years1 = 2008–2009 | team1 = [[Fenerbahçe Men's Basketball|Fenerbahçe]] | years2 = {{nbay|2011|start}}–{{nbay|2014|end}} | team2 = [[Utah Jazz]] | years3 = {{nbay|2014|end}}–{{nbay|2016|end}} | team3 = [[Oklahoma City Thunder]] | years4 = {{nbay|2017|start}}–present | team4 = [[New York Knicks]] | highlights = *[[FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship#MVP Awards (since 1998)|FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship MVP]] ([[2009 FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship|2009]]) * [[Albert Schweitzer Tournament]] Most Talented Player (2008) | nba_profile = enes_kanter | bbr = kanteen01 | medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{TUR}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship]]}} {{MedalBronze | [[2009 FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship|2009 Metz]] | Team}} }} '''Enes Kanter''' (born May 20, 1992) is a Turkish professional [[basketball]] player for the [[New York Knicks]] of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). Standing at {{height|ft=6|in=11}}, he plays at the [[Center (basketball)|center]] position. ==Early life== Kanter was born May 20, 1992, in [[Zürich]], [[Switzerland]],{{cite news |last=Allen |first=Percy |title=Huskies get commitment from 6-foot-10 Turkish star Enes Kanter |url=http://seattletimes.com/html/huskies/2010340248_umen24.html |work=SeattleTimes.com |date=November 23, 2009 |accessdate=February 14, 2015}} while his father, Mehmet, attained his [[Doctor of Medicine|M.D.]] from the [[University of Zurich]]. His father is a professor of [[histology]] at [[Trakya University]].{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/08/sports/ncaabasketball/08basketball.html|title=Turkish Team Says It Paid a Top Kentucky Recruit|first=Pete|last=Thamel|date=7 September 2010|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017|via=NYTimes.com}} Before moving to the United States, Kanter played under [[Serdar Apaydın]]'s management for the [[Fenerbahçe Men's Basketball|Fenerbahçe]] youth squad between 2006 and 2008[http://www.fenerbahce.org/detay.asp?ContentID=16528 Enes Kanter hakkında bilgilendirme] {{tr icon}} and then, during the 2008–09 season, Kanter was a seldom-used reserve for the Fenerbahçe senior team.{{cite web|last=DeCourcy |first=Mike |title=Enes Kanter a revolutionary case for Kentucky, NCAA |work=SportingNews.com |date=April 14, 2010 |url=http://www.sportingnews.com/ncaa-basketball/story/2010-04-14/enes-kanter-revolutionary-case-for-kentucky-ncaa |accessdate=April 21, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100824110049/http://www.sportingnews.com/ncaa-basketball/story/2010-04-14/enes-kanter-revolutionary-case-for-kentucky-ncaa |archivedate=August 24, 2010 |df= }} He played in at least nine games with the team – four in the [[EuroLeague]] and five in the [[Turkish Basketball Super League|Turkish Super League]]. Fenerbahçe and the [[Greek Basket League|Greek League]] basketball team [[Olympiacos B.C.|Olympiacos]] both offered Kanter professional contracts, but he declined because he wanted to play high school and college basketball in the United States. ===Prep school=== In 2009, Kanter moved to the United States, where he enrolled at Stoneridge Preparatory School in [[Simi Valley, California]], and played for the basketball team in 2009–10.{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/high-school/story/_/id/4407971/kanter-enroll-findlay-prep/|title=Top Euro hoopster to enroll at U.S. high school|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017}} At the 2010 [[Nike Hoop Summit]], Kanter played for the international team, recording 34 points and 13 rebounds. His point total was a record for the event, breaking [[Dirk Nowitzki]]'s record set in the 1998 game. Both [[Rivals.com]] and [[Scout.com]] rated Kanter as a five-star prospect, the highest possible rating.{{cite web |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/ncaa/basketball/recruiting/player-Enes-Kanter-102889 |title=ENES KANTER |work=Yahoo.com |accessdate=April 21, 2010}}{{cite web |url=http://scouthoops.scout.com/player/4508332n-enes-kanter |title=Enes Kanter Player Profile News |work=Scout.com |accessdate=April 21, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150214184555/http://scouthoops.scout.com/player/4508332n-enes-kanter |archivedate=February 14, 2015 |df= }} ==College career== On November 23, 2009, Kanter verbally committed to play for the [[Washington Huskies men's basketball|Washington Huskies]]. Kanter chose Washington over [[UCLA Bruins men's basketball|UCLA]], [[USC Trojans men's basketball|USC]], [[Indiana Hoosiers men's basketball|Indiana]] and [[UNLV Runnin' Rebels men's basketball|UNLV]]. However, he re-opened his recruitment in February 2010, and on April 14, Kanter signed a [[National Letter of Intent]] to play college basketball for [[Kentucky Wildcats men's basketball|Kentucky]].{{cite web|url=http://www2.kusports.com/news/2010/may/20/oregon-prep-star-dumps-washington-kentucky/|title=Oregon prep star dumps Washington for Kentucky|website=KUsports.com|accessdate=22 May 2017}} However, despite signing with the Kentucky Wildcats, the [[NCAA]] declared him permanently ineligible as a collegiate athlete because he received approximately $33,000 from Fenerbahçe in excess benefits. The NCAA ruled that this amount was above and beyond what was considered acceptable.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/mens-college-basketball/news/story?id=5793192|title=Kentucky center Kanter ruled ineligible by NCAA|date=11 November 2010|website=ESPN.com|accessdate=22 May 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/sports/college/mensbasketball/sec/2010-11-11-kentucky-kanter-ineligible_N.htm|title=Kentucky forward Enes Kanter ruled permanently ineligible - USATODAY.com|website=usatoday30.usatoday.com|accessdate=22 May 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sportingnews.com/ncaa-basketball/feed/2010-09/enes-kanter|title=Enes Kanter's eligibility|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150214174619/http://www.sportingnews.com/ncaa-basketball/feed/2010-09/enes-kanter|archivedate=14 February 2015|df=}} On January 7, 2011, the NCAA rejected Kentucky's appeal, upholding that Kanter was permanently ineligible.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/08/sports/ncaabasketball/08kentucky.html|title=N.C.A.A. Denies Kentucky’s Appeal Over Kanter’s Eligibility|first=Pete|last=Thamel|date=7 January 2011|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017|via=NYTimes.com}} Without Kanter, Kentucky still managed to reach the Final Four in the [[2011 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]]. ==Professional career== ===Utah Jazz (2011–2015)=== Kanter was drafted third overall by the [[Utah Jazz]] in the [[2011 NBA draft]]. Upon being drafted, he said "I'm so happy, I'm so excited. I know the Utah Jazz fans are crazy and I love them. I will bring the team toughness and post moves, rebounding, everything. I will try to do everything to make the playoffs."{{cite web|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/700146517/Utah-Jazz-select-Enes-Kanter-with-third-pick.html|title=Utah Jazz select Enes Kanter with third pick|first=Randy|last=Hollis|date=23 June 2011|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017}} On December 9, 2011, he signed his rookie scale contract with the Jazz following the conclusion of the [[2011 NBA lockout|NBA lockout]].{{cite web | url = http://www.nba.com/jazz/news/jazz_sign_kanter_and_burks.html | title = Jazz Signs 2011 Lottery Picks | work = NBA.com | date = December 9, 2011 | accessdate = December 10, 2011}} In 2011–12, he became just the 10th Jazz rookie in franchise history to appear in every regular season game. He also recorded the most rebounds for a Jazz rookie on debut with 11 against the [[Los Angeles Lakers]] on December 27. On the season, he averaged 4.6 points and 4.2 rebounds in 66 games. [[File:Patrick Beverley goes up for a shot against Enes Kanter (cropped2).jpg|thumb|right|230px|Kanter attempts to block [[Patrick Beverley]]'s shot during a game on March 17, 2014, at the Toyota Center in Houston, Texas.]] In 2012–13, Kanter improved his averages in every major statistical category, led the team in scoring three times and rebounding four times, and scored in double-figures 22 times. In 70 games (two starts), he averaged 7.2 points and 4.3 rebounds per game. On March 1, 2013, Kanter had the first 20-20 game of his career with career-highs of 23 points and 22 rebounds to lead the Jazz to a 98–68 victory over the [[Charlotte Bobcats]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/games/20130301/CHAUTA/gameinfo.html|title=Bobcats at Jazz|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017}} He later missed the final 10 games of the season due to a dislocated left shoulder. In 2013–14, Kanter appeared in 80 games (37 starts), averaging 12.3 points and 7.5 rebounds per game. On March 3, 2014, he scored a then career-high 27 points in a 114–88 loss to the [[Milwaukee Bucks]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/jazz/rundown/20140303|title=The Rundown - Jazz at Bucks 3.3.14 - THE OFFICIAL SITE OF THE UTAH JAZZ|website=www.nba.com|accessdate=22 May 2017}} On December 16, 2014, Kanter scored a then career-high 29 points in a 119–111 loss to the [[New Orleans Pelicans]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/jazz/news/roundup-jazz-111-pelicans-118|title=The Roundup—Jazz 111, Pelicans 119 - Utah Jazz|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017}} ===Oklahoma City Thunder (2015–2017)=== On February 19, 2015, Kanter was traded to the [[Oklahoma City Thunder]] in a three-team deal that also involved the [[Detroit Pistons]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/thunder/news/release_150219|title=Thunder Acquires Kanter, Novak, Augustin, Singler and Draft Pick|work=NBA.com|date=February 19, 2015|accessdate=February 20, 2015}} Two days later, he made his debut for the Thunder, recording a double-double with 10 points and 13 rebounds in a 110–103 win over the [[Charlotte Hornets]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/games/20150221/OKCCHA/gameinfo.html|title=Westbrook nets 33, Thunder top Hornets 110-103 minus Durant|work=NBA.com|date=February 21, 2015|accessdate=February 21, 2015}} On April 1, 2015, he scored a then career-high 30 points in a 135–131 loss to the [[Dallas Mavericks]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/games/20150401/DALOKC/gameinfo.html|title=Mavs beat Thunder 135-131 despite Westbrook triple-double|work=NBA.com|date=April 1, 2015|accessdate=April 1, 2015}} After the 2014–15 season, Kanter became a [[restricted free agent (NBA)|restricted free agent]]. On July 9, 2015, he received a four-year, $70 million offer sheet from the [[Portland Trail Blazers]].{{cite web|last=Wojnarowski|first=Adrian|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/sources--restricted-free-agent-enes-kanter-to-sign--70-million-max-offer-sheet-with-blazers-200612546.html|title=Sources: Restricted free agent Enes Kanter signs $70 million max offer sheet with Blazers|work=Yahoo.com|date=July 9, 2015|accessdate=July 9, 2015}} However, three days later, the Thunder exercised their right of first refusal and matched the offer sheet extended to Kanter by the Trail Blazers.{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/thunder/news/kanter_150712|title=Thunder Matches Offer Sheet for Kanter|work=NBA.com|date=July 12, 2015|accessdate=July 13, 2015}} On March 14, 2016, he scored a then season-high 26 points in a 128–94 win over the Portland Trail Blazers.{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/games/20160314/POROKC/gameinfo.html|title=Westbrook's triple-double leads Thunder past Trail Blazers|work=NBA.com|date=March 14, 2016|accessdate=March 15, 2016}} On April 6, he recorded a career-high 33 points and 20 rebounds in a 120–115 loss to the Portland Trail Blazers,{{cite web|url=http://www.nba.com/games/20160406/OKCPOR/gameinfo.html|title=Trail Blazers defeat Thunder 120-115, clinch playoff berth|work=NBA.com|date=April 6, 2016|accessdate=April 7, 2016}} becoming the first player in Thunder history to score at least 30 points and grab 20 rebounds in a game.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f3AqxPdF2jM|title=Enes Kanter Records First 30/20 Game in Thunder History|work=YouTube.com|date=April 6, 2016|accessdate=April 7, 2016}} In Game 3 of the Thunder's first-round playoff series against the Dallas Mavericks, Kanter recorded a playoff career-high 21 points and a game-high eight rebounds in a 131–102 win, claiming a 2–1 series with another triple-double as Thunder stop Knicks|work=ESPN.com|date=November 28, 2016|accessdate=November 29, 2016}} On January 26, 2017, he sustained a fractured forearm after punching a chair on He joined [[Wilt Chamberlain]], [[Bill Russell]] and [[Bob Lanier (basketball)|Bob Lanier]] as the only players with a 30-20 game on Christmas.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400974445|title=Embiid, Redick help 76ers beat Knicks, end 5-game skid|work=ESPN.com|date=December 25, 2017|accessdate=December 25, 2017}} On January 30, 2018, he recorded 20 points, 20 rebounds and five assists in a 111–95 win over the [[Brooklyn Nets]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400975491|title=Knicks rout Nets again to finish sweep of season series|work=ESPN.com|date=January 30, 2018|accessdate=January 30, 2018}} On February 6, 2018, in a 103–89 loss to the [[Milwaukee Bucks]], Kanter recorded 19 points and 16 rebounds for his sixth consecutive double-double, marking the longest streak by any Knick since [[David Lee (basketball)|David Lee]] had seven straight from February 9–26, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400975547|title=Giannis dunks over Knicks, who lose Porzingis to knee injury|work=ESPN.com|date=February 6, 2018|accessdate=February 6, 2018}} On March 6, 2018, he had 18 points and 11 rebounds in a 111–87 loss to the [[Portland Trail Blazers]]. He dominated throughout the tournament, averaging 22.9 points, 16.5 rebounds and 1.5 blocks in 34.6 minutes per game. However, [[Jonas Valančiūnas]] was chosen as the MVP after he averaged 14.3 points, 11.1 rebounds and 2.3 blocks in 23.5 minutes. Kanter went on to earn MVP honors at the [[2009 FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship]] after averaging 18.6 points and 16.4 rebounds while leading Turkey's junior national team to the bronze medal. He declined to play for the senior national team at the [[2010 FIBA World Championship]] which was being held in Turkey as the team went on to win the silver medal. His father claimed he did this in order not to miss the first month of classes at Kentucky.{{cite web|url=http://www.sportingnews.com/ncaa-basketball/feed/2010-09/enes-kanter/story/enes-kanters-father-says-turkish-club-is-trying-to-make-an-example-of-his-son|title=Enes Kanter's father says Turkish club is 'trying to make an example' of his son|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141019113917/http://www.sportingnews.com/ncaa-basketball/feed/2010-09/enes-kanter/story/enes-kanters-father-says-turkish-club-is-trying-to-make-an-example-of-his-son|archivedate=19 October 2014|df=}} Kanter played with the Turkish senior team for the first time at the [[FIBA EuroBasket 2011|2011 EuroBasket]]. He appeared in eight games and averaged 9.6 points and 3.9 rebounds per game.{{cite web|url=http://www.eurobasket2011.com/en/cid_4,w7QjPeH-M,ty138LH2l3.playerID_61806.compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_2011.roundID_7983.teamID_376.html|title=Enes Kanter (Turkey)|publisher=|accessdate=22 May 2017}} Kanter was left off the team's roster for [[EuroBasket 2015]]. '''Engineering law''' (or law in engineering) is the [[empirical]] study of the application of [[laws]] and legal [[strategy]] in [[engineering]]. Applied law aims to explain how [[law]] interacts with [[industry]]. The current [[school of thought]] within the academic community of [[lawyers]] and [[engineers]] is the [[wikt:pragmatic|pragmatic]] [[paradigm]]. Commonly, professionals have a [[Bachelors in Engineering]] and a [[Bachelors in Law]], and increasingly commonly a [[Masters of Business Administration]]. Pragmatic application of [[laws]] means the [[empirical]] study of how a [[corporate]] legal framework should be adopted.
== Graduate attributes and professional competencies == The requirements from the perspective of the Washington Accord are for engineering graduates to attain the following knowledge and skill: 'WA6: Apply reasoning informed by contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to professional engineering practice and solutions to complex engineering problems.'
== Sub topics == Key topic areas for engineering law are: * Contract administration, especially in construction, procurement, and supply chain. * Product liability, especially for manufactured products. * Intellectual property (IP) protection, which includes patents, copyrights, etc. * Safety legislation and regulations, which includes plant safety, risk management, food safety. * Standards and certification, which are product-specific constraints on design and testing processes. Patent Law, which are to help people do patent on any goods.
